title: Does debt transfer to adult children?
question: My mother does not claim me as a dependent. She has significant credit card debt and little to no savings. In addition, she recently lost her job and has no health insurance.
answers: No. Unless you agreed to be responsible, you would not personally be responsible for her debts, but if she does pass and leaves any assets in her own name necessitating the opening of an estate to pass them to her heirs, the creditors would have a claim against those assets. If there are no assets, there is nothing they could make a claim to.
